intro: Luzula albida var. macrantha, commonly known as the white wood rush, is a perennial plant native to parts of Asia and North America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly referred to as the grass family. The plant features slender, upright stems covered in dense, soft white to pale green foliage. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets that bear small, white to pale blue flowers. Luzula albida var. macrantha typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
